intro: Saurauia tomentosa var. sprucei, commonly known as the woolly saurauia, is a species of flowering plant in the Ericaceae family. It is characterized by its dense, woolly white tomentum covering its stems and leaves, which gives it a distinctive appearance. Native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, it thrives in cool, humid environments with well-drained soil. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, and it is often found in forest understories. Its unique morphology and habitat make it an interesting subject for botanical study and conservation efforts.
